author: imman6820
content: <@97774605351010304> how does the country count work? I moved my lighthouse client to my local machine where I already had prysm running, but the node count didn't increase.

author: butta
content: based on IP, we just restarted it

author: torfbolt
content: This is all based on ipv4, correct? Do we have any nodes running on ipv6? Are there ways to test/force the use of ipv6 for a client?

author: torfbolt
content: Ok, just configured my staking machine for ipv6 only and that failed pretty much. Neither lighthouse nor prysm find any peers.

author: torfbolt
content: Both start their p2p service with an ipv4 address

author: ajsutton
content: Teku works with IPv6 but finding peers only on IPv6 will be very difficult as there are almost node that advertise IPv6 addresses.

author: ajsutton
content: Theoretically its possible to advertise both v4 and v6 addresses in a single ENR but I'm not sure if any clients do.

author: ajsutton
content: I've run a number of IPv6 only testnets without issue in the past though.

author: torfbolt
content: Ok, I might also try teku for this. Would I need an ipv6 boot node, is there one?

author: ajsutton
content: Let me check if our bootnode has IPv6 I think it might.

author: ajsutton
content: Hmm, doesn't seem to have public IPv6.
